name: Rocksmith™
description: Rocksmith’s innovative game design makes playing music visually intuitive and will engage experienced musicians as well as those who have never picked up a guitar in their lives.
minimum_requirements: OS:Windows Vista, Windows 7 Processor:2.0 GHz Intel® Core™2 Duo E4400 or 2.0 GHz AMD Athlon™ 64 X2 3800+ Memory:2 GB RAM Graphics:256 MB DirectX 9 / NVIDIA® GeForce® 8600 GT or ATI Radeon™ HD 2600 XT DirectX®:9.0 Hard Drive:12 GB HD space Sound:DirectX 9.0c-compliant

reviews.review_text: I recomend it purely because of it's arcade style pogression. It's missing from the 2014 version. The new 2014 version dosen't feel like a game at all. It feels like a practice program. This original game feels like a game should. Praise and objectives are much more fun to recieve than the new version. If you want to learn guitar , but are more into video games I think this would work better for you than 2014.

Here's how the game mostly works. The game requires a special cable that allows you to plug your guitar into your computer. So just downloading the game won't allow you to play it unless you have that special interface cable. Once you plug in and tweak your options, the basic campaign will give you the simple 'Rocksmith' experience. When you first start, all of the songs are not yet 'leveled up,' so you only need to play just a few notes of the melody, and probably no chords at all. But as you play each song again and again, the game figures out which sections of the song you're getting good at, and increases the difficulty, add more of the melody's original notes. This goes on continually, for every song you play, making the game increasingly more challenging the more you play it. After you have played each song and 'leveled them up' to maximum, you'll basically be playing the song as it was recorded.  As a 'guitar instruction' method, I really think this has potential. The early part of the game is simple enough that really ANYONE could play it, and the more you play, the more the game challenges you as a guitar player. Each song as a few different arrangements, some focusing on lead, some on rhythm and chords. The game is a harsh judge, so make sure you hit EVERY note, not just the ones that are easy to play!  As some who already plays guitar, I found the game was most rewarding when I was selecting individual songs to play from the game's catalogue, without bothering with the campaign at all. I sort of knew how to play Outshined already, but learning how to REALLY play it without cheating was a treat. I pick a song I like, and practice all the parts of it individually until I can play them all, then I try to put them all together by playing the complete song on the maximum level. Sometimes I can pull it off, depends on the song.  So if you're already a guitar player, or you are really interested in learning to play, this game is definitely for you! Tons of new songs to play as downloadable content. But if you're a 'gamer' who's not really much of a musician, even if you really liked Guitar Hero, I'd say this game is probably not your cup of tea. It's more of a 'musician's thing' than a game.  The game also features support for basses, and an entire campaign just for bass players. FINALLY, some respect!

Cant decide between Rocksmith and rocksmith2014? let me help you. Are you experienced? Then buy Rrocksmith 2014. Are you new? Buy rocksmith 2011. Rocksmith 2011's songs are good, but they are easier compared to Rocksmith 2014s.
This game made me play guitar for several hours and it still hasn't gotten me laid 0/10 total ripoff
This game is great for those 2AM rumble bass jam sessions. Your neighbors will loathe you. Buy a second cable so they can join in.
I prefer this than 2014. I love the 'career' mode.

Having picked up Rocksmith today and played for about 3 hours, I am now capable of playing a song on the guitar; which is more songs than I could play prior to getting Rocksmith. I can also play the aforementioned song with a level of proficiency that gives off the allusion that I kinda know what the hell I'm doing. I don't, yet, but at least I'm on the right path to figuring it all out. In short: Rocksmith is working as intended.
Brought me new motivation to play my 6 year old guitar. And im actually learning to play it.  Though, it is overpriced, specially the dlc content.  The port could be better, the console menus suck.
If you want a game that actually helps you learn how to play bass/guitar, and you don't want the 'guitar hero' button pushing, this is the right game for you! Worth the $30.00 USD

This game is very recommended for beginner to become really guitarist..get your guitar, and real tone cable...then play the game..  I have both 2014 and this one. I recommend this for beginner. Trust me, its work!
Works great when the DRM cord doesn't have a heart attack and ruin your game.

[8.9/10]  For those who've never played guitar before, it may be an enjoyable game and a structured way to learn. If you think you're an experienced guitar player, don't worry. The arcade mini-games in Guitarcade and additions of the amp will let you become crack addicted to them and be unable to stop playing.  No matter how good you are, you won't put down the guitar until your body demands it.That's for sure !
It's fun
I have rocksmith 2014 on my xbox and mastered all songs and now I got this on my pc and enjoying it af, it's so rad for guitarists to play this game bc it's easy and fun xD
I enjoy it, i especially enjoy it when the songs are 40% off

I originally got this game to try to get back into playing the guitar... I remembered it recently and started playing. I spent maybe 45 minutes in the game, at least 15 of these were unskippable 'tutorials' that didn't actually contain ANYTHING relevant even for a beginner. The UI is clunky and slow at best and I honestly uninstalled it just now. I'd rather learn the old fashioned way from a book than ever deal with that UI again. If I hadn't bought this so long ago and forgotten it I would be applying for a refund. As it is, I had more enjoyment typing a review than playing the actual game. if you have patience for bad UI and overall design this might be a good solution for you, but I personally refuse to lower my standards on what I'm willing to deal with and therefor this goes into the 'games I bought and played once then never touched again' stack with the likes of divinity II and other garbage.  I should note that I spent VERY little time actually playing this game so the review maybe not so much on gameplay, but the time spent with the menu made me absolutely hate this game before even going into playing it.
This game is amazing! It has helped me with my guitar skills, and has some fun Mini-games as well!

This game is probably really great if you already have a good familiarity with guitar and are around the intermediate level of skill. With its automatic difficulty increases that you can't do anything about unless you restart the entire game and lack of documentation, itntroducing unexplained symbols etc, and if you are a total beginner looking for a learning tool, look elsewhere. get a lesson. This game was designed by people who knew how to play guitar. More likely they were really good at it in fact. I do not feel that there was a connection there with the devs and the total beginner. This is more like a practice tool for a decently skilled guitarist. Maybe the 2014 edition's better but I'm not paying for the same damn game twice if the first one was a dissapointment.

My own problem: Bought this game thinking it would help teach methe guitar, no such mode, it's just play this song at full speed then when you're used to it we will change it and suddenly it's too difficult Actual issue: you have to check the tuning of your guitar EVERY SINGLE SONG and while playing the song if you hit the right not it will probably say it's the wrong one and you should move up a fret which is the worst when you know you're playing that note

VERY BAD VERY BAD well, why? i played this game about 5 hours and now i can not play it now because why?? that cable real tone doesn't work now, not work!!!! well, i love playing guitar, but this ♥♥♥♥ cable is broken or i don't know what the isue with this things ♥♥♥♥

Really fun game, seems to give everything that beginner player needs in to the long journey of music realm. Also really fun to just play even if you know how to play instruments. Songs get harder progressively which is really awesome since it helps to learn to song.
In my humble opinion... the best game ever made. No more talking about it to not wear it out ^^ hihihi
I still can't play guitar very well.  The songs are all expensive as heck.  6/10
This is a guitar game.
Wanna learn guitar? Play this. Wanna learn any song you want? Smithy Anvil, ready go.

I love both the game and the concept, but there are far too many technical issues, not to mention the extra expense for a cable. Too much lag between time string is plucked and sound is registered. To many issues to be enjoyed. :(

It's the ultimate rythmn game. It will actually teach you guitar! I've learned so much from this program already and there's still so much still to learn. Guitar Practice has never been more easy or more fun.
It really does help improve your skills on guitar. Takes a bit to get used to the string color-coding, but once you do...
Awesome way to learn guitar \:D/
I finally have a use for all the guitars I keep telling myself I'm going to teach myself how to play.
I love playing real guitar and this helps somewhat. If you are a noob on guitar I'd still suggest taking lessons, but it's a fancy way of playing tabs.
This game is awesome!
Highly recommended for people with no skills.
Epic game for learninig guitar

I was albeit a bit skeptical when I saw this game, thinking 'This is too good to be true!' And though there are a few flaws with it, it has overall surpassed my expectations. You really do learn how to play guitar, just like in your favorite rock songs. My few issues are: due to its awesomeness, it's damn near impossible to find the real tone cable in a real store - you have to order them via gamestop or newegg, and they are quite pricey; also, the price point is a bit high for the DLC and it's kind of tricky to find songs that you'll like; I wish the recommendation system was better implemented, and of course, there are all sorts forms you have to fill out to recommend a song.  Still, quite an amazing piece of software, if you own a guitar and don't want to spend a whole lot of money on lessons before you find out that you hate guitar, I would recommend this for you. 95 out of 100.

I was blown away by this programme. Its supposed to be a game that teaches guitar but its so much more. The game reacts dynamically to my playing. I started off playing the Stones (yes that's right the real stones as in the Rolling Stones not that roses muck) classic 'I can't get no satisfaction' hitting around 75% accuracy on the notes before hitting 85% today. Mastering other songs at a speed of knots.  Great for re-kindling your relationship with your prized Fender or Les Paul. I hadn't seriously played for more than 10 minutes in the last 14 years and now I am re-awakening my love for lead guitar.
Great Game For Learning Songs On A Real Guitar Or Bass Easy To Pick Up Can Be Hard To Master

A very very nice game, it had me from the start.  I did play the guitar for a several years already, but it was basically my dream game. I always imagined the guitarhero kind of game, but with a real guitar. It was a terrible pain to wait for it to come out in Europe due to licenscing problems.  The game itself does have some bad(ish) aspects (e.g. interface - sometimes it gets a click-play-click fest, just to switch songs or riff parts) But it didn't really bother me, I could perfectly live with those. The fact you are actually playing a song on your own guitar, while you just read the fluent stream of tabs and play along with the real song.. well that was my dream!  However, I do recommend to new players Rocksmith 2014! It has solved all the bad(ish) aspects of this Rocksmith and includes whole new features. If not for the songs, definitely buy rocksmith 2014 if you are in doubt, but ofc, if you like most songs of this one more, then buy this rocksmith first. Because after all, the best part is and stays the fact you can play along with your beloved songs!

I've been playing electric guitar for about 5-6, maybe more, but this game makes playing guitar so much fun!!! You shouldn't buy it for learning guitar, but for enjoying it, and even getting faster. BUY IT NOW!!! YOU WON'T REGRET!!!
great fun if your first starting off or have been playing for years
Want to learn to play guitar..  Why not Rocksmith?
You thought your fingers hurt after guitar hero! Take your fingers for a walk ♥♥♥♥♥es, its time to rock! XD

I started playing guitar with this game and it's a really awsome tool to learn how to play, Sure it was bugs and gitches but overall it's so fun! I highmy recommend this if you have an electric guitar but can't be asked to go to lessons or don't have the time to watch youtube videos over and over! With over 200h (ikr) on the game there's so much content! With all the extra dlc and the user created content AND the guitarcade you can really enjoy the game still after mastering all the original songs :')

I have this game on PS3 since like 1 year and purchased it once again but on PC. If you never touched a guitar or bass or you naster it quiet well, either ways, it's still a great game for both. The game match the difficulty with your skills so you go at your own speed which is great for beginners.
It is brilliant. If you ever thought of playing a guitar, get this game. Seriously.
Awesome game for those who liked the guitar hero and rockband games, if your looking to learn guitar or already play. Then this is definitely a game for you.

Great guitar teeching game. It doesn't replace a proper teacher but you learn how to play a good amount of Rock songs in an enjoyable way. Perhaps some basic guitar experience is desirable to enjoy, but it's fantastic anyway. It made me play guitar again, after a 4 year pause, and that's an accomplishment.
rocksmith is a great educational game. I went from not even knowing what a chord is to being able to play almost anything in 37 hours.
This game is pretty awesome! It teaches ya some basics and has good songs.

As a complete guitar beginner, I was given this game by someone upgrading to Rocksmith 2014. Plugging in everything was easy, the first song catchy and simple to pick up, and the song list is impressive.   I've improved drastically since starting to play this in conjunction with some how-to videos and a chord book. It's clearly based off the idea and popularity of Guitar Hero, but don't expect it to follow naturally if you are a Hero hero. More finger movement, callouses and goddammit stop scooping the string, you're scooping the string don't do that make for a interesting gaming challenge.   It's not perfect: the multiplayer occasionally refuses to pick up the second player (usually me, making my already abysmal scores plummet) and even single player drops quite a few notes if the cord is not aligned correctly. And with the Steam version, you do need to buy that cord seperately.   However, I could play this game for hours. Feeling like an actual musician when you can fret without looking at it rocks and the first time you master a chord in-song is the most exhilarating thing. I've seen 2014 played and there is a lot of improvement in the interface, pickup and subtlety of the game, but Rocksmith still holds its own. The songs are solid, the gameplay is intuitive and you get to be a rockstar to crowds of enthusiastic 2d cut-outs. Really something I would recommend to rock enthusiasts and wannabe musicians alike.
Awesome way to help you to learn guitar or bass, fun and intuitive. Will keep you playing for hours

I like this game, it's really fun, and it's kinda like guitarr hero but more complicated. The only thing is it sometimes has problems registering the notes it seems, especially on the low E string, you have to play the note early in order for it to register that you played it. Over all though it's a good game and it's fun yet challenging.

A great way to have fun with songs you like and the new ones you will like because you heard them in this game. A unique concept. The interface gets annoying pretty quick (tuning guitar everytime, menu animations). Sometimes the game is too easy on you in judging how you played, sometimes its too hard (like hitting bends), so there is some unbalance. But overall great game for guitar and bass players who want to get playing, better at it or just anal in learning their favorite solos.
Definately worth it, if you want to learn or play guitar... not hype.

Having played both this and RS2014, I'd recommend getting this first as a beginner. Sure, RS2014 offers new features, new songs and fixes some annoyances, but as a (intermediate) beginner I definitely experienced a smoother start in Rocksmith. The career mode makes you feel much more like you're progressing, the lack of said career mode (which can be cumbersome and frustrating) makes you feel like you're just plucking away at one song over and over, much like learning guitar by yourself using a book/DVD. As a side-note, career mode is not the only feature RS1 offers over RS2014.  Thus, I'd recommend getting this game (maybe retail with the cable, likely cheaper than Steam overall, outside of sales) and then 'upgrading' to Rocksmith 2014 once you've played through a good amount of the career mode, at least that's how I did it and I feel like it was a good transition. I might even rate RS(1) higher, overall.
Highly recommended. It makes me want to practice every day. Makes learning waaay easier.
Tablature Hero featuring Eric Clapton.
